ModMetadata.Author: Sukasa
ModMetadata.Description:
[b]WARNING:[/b] This is a StationeersLaunchPad Plugin Mod. It requires Bepinex to be installed with the StationeersLaunchPad plugin. See: https://github.com/StationeersLaunchPad/StationeersLaunchPad
[h1]âš¡ Re-Volt âš¡[/h1]
Re-Volt is an electrical overhaul mod for Stationeers, which mildly overhauls how power is distributed, what happens when things go wrong, and gives you more tools to control your power!
[h2]ðŸ”Œ Features[/h2]
[b]Electrical load is now proportionally shared among all sources on a cable network![/b] No longer will you have to deal with one battery draining while the others are completely full!
[b]Wires no longer burn out instantly![/b] Instead, wires will burn out with a random chance, based on how much you're overloading them. It never made sense that a cable which could carry 5,000 watts continuously would violently rupture in half a second when carrying 5,001 watts. And now it doesn't.
[b]Stationary batteries are now charge- and discharge-rate limited.[/b] A single battery isn't going to take 100kW anymore, and these babies can discharge a fair bit quicker than they charge. You might need to re-design your power distribution, or use a few more batteries in parallel!
[b]Fuses still work.[/b] As long as there is a fuse rated low enough to protect the cable, that fuse will ALWAYS blow instead of a cable. And fuses blow instantly, no time delay.
[b]Complex/recursive electrical networks are allowed.[/b] With the revised power simulation, the limit on transformers or batteries in recursive networks has been lifted. Over-engineer your bases to your heart's delight!.
[h2]ðŸ“… Future Plans[/h2]
In future, there are a few more components planned out: [list] [*] Either reversed small breakers, or [b]bi-directional breakers[/b]. I'm not sure which, yet. [*] Heavy Breakers, capable of interrupting much larger amounts of power [*] Smart variants of both, able to be monitored and controlled over the data network! [/list]
[h1]ðŸ§¾ Credits[/h1]
Nothing is ever born in a vacuum, and neither was this mod. HUGE thanks to a number of folks in the Stationeers Modding Discord, and of course to Rocketwerkz for just being as awesome as they are.

If you need support, you can reach out here or on the Stationeers Modding Discord, in the Re-Volt project post, or on the Github repository at https://github.com/sukasa/revolt
